repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4061.

Code is adjusted per discussion in issue to always add value to `default_args` or `default_kwargs`.

comment_data.body:
I think these tests should go in `cyfunction_defaults`

https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/efdf996dced075682d86b7e53a12b56b5ebfea38/tests/run/cyfunction_defaults.pyx

Wait and see, but I think this might fail on some of the earlier versions of Python that we still support (because inspect won't understand `/,`). It might be easier to check `C.__defaults__` and `C.__kwdefaults__` since this is what inspect uses.

If you want to include some tests with `inspect` then you might have to put some version checks in.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+# mode: run
+# tag: default arguments
+
+cdef class C:
+    def f1(self, a, b=1, c=[]):
+        pass
+    def f2(self, a, b=1,/, c=[1]):
+        pass
+
+
+def check():
+    """
+    >>> import inspect
+    >>> inspect.signature(C.f1)
+    <Signature (self, a, b=1, c=[])>
+    >>> inspect.signature(C.f2)
+    <Signature (self, a, b=1, /, c=[1])>

comment_data.body: This seems reasonable, I'll update test to use `__defaults__ ` and   `__kwdefaults__ `
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+# mode: run
+# tag: default arguments
+
+cdef class C:
+    def f1(self, a, b=1, c=[]):
+        pass
+    def f2(self, a, b=1,/, c=[1]):
+        pass
+
+
+def check():
+    """
+    >>> import inspect
+    >>> inspect.signature(C.f1)
+    <Signature (self, a, b=1, c=[])>
+    >>> inspect.signature(C.f2)
+    <Signature (self, a, b=1, /, c=[1])>

comment_data.body: Why only these two? Why is this constraint needed?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9371,21 +9371,22 @@ def analyse_default_args(self, env):
         # so their optional arguments must be static, too.
         # TODO: change CyFunction implementation to pass both function object and owning object for method calls
         must_use_constants = env.is_c_class_scope or (self.def_node.is_wrapper and env.is_module_scope)
-
         for arg in self.def_node.args:
-            if arg.default and not must_use_constants:
-                if not arg.default.is_literal:
-                    arg.is_dynamic = True
-                    if arg.type.is_pyobject:
-                        nonliteral_objects.append(arg)
+            if arg.default:
+                if not must_use_constants:
+                    if not arg.default.is_literal:
+                        arg.is_dynamic = True
+                        if arg.type.is_pyobject:
+                            nonliteral_objects.append(arg)
+                        else:
+                            nonliteral_other.append(arg)
                     else:
-                        nonliteral_other.append(arg)
-                else:
-                    arg.default = DefaultLiteralArgNode(arg.pos, arg.default)
-                if arg.kw_only:
-                    default_kwargs.append(arg)
-                else:
-                    default_args.append(arg)
+                        arg.default = DefaultLiteralArgNode(arg.pos, arg.default)
+                if arg.type.is_pyobject or arg.type.is_numeric:

comment_data.body:
This was added to make sure that only primitives/pyobjects (which also includes `unicode` and `str`) could be added to `__(kw)defaults__` which would  block cases like `cpdef f(char* arg = NULL)`. 

Alternative would be to do nothing and in which case this example will end up being compile time error but it might break some existing code  that used to compile  fine before.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

+                if arg.type.is_pyobject or arg.type.is_numeric:

comment_data.body: I think `arg.type` should have a function `can_coerce_to_pyobject`?

comment_data.body: Does `arg.default` have a type? I think it may sometimes be different from `arg.type` (e.g. null pointers).

comment_data.body: Yes, in this case it is `<CPtrType <CVoidType>>` (code in question is `cpdef f(char* arg = NULL)`)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
                if arg.default.type and arg.default.type.can_coerce_to_pyobject(env):
```

This seems to pass `python runtests.py cyfunction default signature` (i.e. all the tests in this question, plus some related ones)

commit.message: Preserve default arguments values on methods for introspection
